title: Normal Distribution: Calculus Exam
question_text: Free-response questions on the AP Calculus Exam are scored $0$ through $9$ .  A question  on one of the previous exams  had an average score of $3.10$ with a standard deviation of $2.45$ . What was the approximate score achieved by a student that would put him or her in the $87$ th percentile on this question? You may  assume the scores on this question are approximately normally distributed.
